Award.AwardTitle: US Executive Participation in Bernoulli Society for Mathematical Statistics and Probability
Award.AbstractNarration: Travel support to attend and participate in conferences sponsored by the Bernoulli Society for Mathematical Statistics and Probability (BSMSP) is requested for the period 2010-2014 of four years during which the PI will serve as president-elect (2010-2012) and president (2012-2014) of BSMSP. BSMSP is an international professional society devoted to the advancement of education and research in probability and mathematical statistics. The goals of BSMP are continued outreach to mathematical scientists in both developed and developing countries throughout the world as a professional society uniting intrinsic scientific interests in mathematical statistics and probability. The benefit of BSMSP to the overall US scientific enterprise is evident in the many collaborative publications that have evolved as the result of opportunities for its members to meet under the sponsorship of a professional society whose international credibility traces back to the very beginnings of the field. In addition it provides a professional forum for mentorship of postdocs and graduate students through various committees engaged in education, scientific discourse, and networking among professional educators and researchers. It is the duty of the executive council to provide liaison and direct major committees of BSMSP to continue to achieve these broad benefits and goals. The educational impact of BSMSP is enhanced by making membership free to PhD students with a sliding scale for postdocs and members from developing countries. BSMSP works cooperatively with the Institute of Mathematical Statistics (IMS), headquartered in the United States, and the International Statistical Institute (ISI), headquartered in The Netherlands, and is an essential organization in facilitating continued international cooperation in mathematical statistics and probability. Support of this proposal facilitates the PIs travel for participation in select international meetings and conferences involving (BSMSP) in an executive capacity.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This project was to provide partial support of travel to international research conferences in probability and mathematical statistics for the PI while serving as the president-elect and president of the Bernoulli Society for Mathematical Statsitics and Probability.   This invovled participation in  International Statistical Institue World Congresses in Dublin, Ireland and in Hong Kong, China a Bernoulli World Congress in Istanbul, Turkey,  Bernoulli Conferences in Stochastic Processes and their Applications in Oaxaca, Mexico, Boulder, Colorado, and Joint Statistics Meeting in Montreal, Canada.  

At each of these meetings the PI made public addresses in an executive leadership role to both convey research progress, recognize and honor achievements, encourage and support young researchers, and to identify areas of need in future research.  Since this covered the Special International Year of Statistics 2013,  special efforts were made to organize public awareness lectures on the impact, value and needs  of research in mathematical statistics and probability in modern society.  In addition the PI presented results of his own research in areas of applications to mathematical biology.  The primary focus of this research is on dispersion in highly heterogeneous environments.  A comprehensive survey article of results in this area is available though the co-authored publication Statistical Science,  Institute of Mathematical Statistics, vol 28, no 4, pages 407-509, entitled Advection-Dispersion Across Interfaces, DOI: 10.1214/13-STS442 The funding of this project was purely to support travel and participation in conferences and did not involve overhead charges by Oregon State University.
